identity.description: Paper-based metadata example derived from Bhardwaj et al. (arXiv:2405.04223, 2024). This is a stationary laboratory cold-atom gravimeter in fountain geometry, using Doppler-sensitive two-photon Raman pulse atom interferometry. Values included here are those explicitly stated in the paper HTML.
identity.model: Cold Atom Gravimeter (CAG) - single laser operated fountain

atomicSource.isotopeDetail: Laser cooled 87Rb launched vertically in atomic fountain geometry
atomicSource.notes: Paper describes use of Doppler-sensitive two-photon Raman excitation and internal-state atom interferometry. It also states the system was operated without seismic vibration corrections during the reported measurements.

pulseSequence.notes: Raman pulse atom interferometry for g measurement in fountain geometry.

accuracy.note: Reported local g value (laboratory) in the paper HTML.

sensitivity.note: Allan deviation / sensitivity for 1350 s integration time, as reported.

performance.notes: Paper also reports a resolution of 270 uGal for the g estimate obtained from the Raman chirp method.

reference.title: Measurement of gravitational acceleration in a single laser operated atomic fountain
HTML version: Measurement of gravitational acceleration in a single laser operated atomic fountain

provenance.citation: Bhardwaj, K. et al. (2024). Measurement of gravitational acceleration in a single laser operated atomic fountain. arXiv:2405.04223.
